Functions for removing line noise from signals

pyiEEGfeatures.IIR_notch_filter.Implement_Notch_Filter(fs, band, freq, ripple, order, filter_type, data)
Parameters

  • fs (float) – frequency sampling

  • band (list) – the bandwidth around the center-line frequency that you wish to filter

  • freq (float) – the center - line frequency to be filtered

  • ripple (float) – the maximum pass-band ripple that is allowed in db

  • order (int) – the filter order. For FIR notch filters this is best set to 2 or 3, IIR filters are best suited for high values of order.

  • filter_type (str) – the type of the filter; ‘butter’, ‘bessel’, ‘cheby1’, ‘cheby2’, ‘ellip’

  • data (array) – the data to be filtered

Returns

the filtered data

Return type

np.array

pyiEEGfeatures.IIR_notch_filter.iirnotch_filter(fs, notch_frequency, quality_factor, data)
Parameters

  • fs – frequency sampling, in Hz

  • notch_freq – the center-line frequency to be filtered

  • quality_factor – the quality factor. see details in scipy.signal.iirnotch()

  • data – signal the filtered will be applied

Returns

signal after applying the filter

Return type

np.array
